article_title: H&R Block warns of PPACA tax filing danger
article_text:
Some APTC recipients may have earned too little to have to file returns at all under the old rules.

The public exchange plan users who are getting advance premium tax credit (APTC) help have to file tax returns to keep their APTC subsidies.

Health care tax service marketers at H&R Block (NYSE:HRB), a tax preparation firm, are wondering whether APTC users understand the return filing requirement.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Allison Bell
article_metadata.description: Premium subsidy recipients may not understand that they have to file tax returns.

article_summary:
Health care tax service marketers at H&R Block (NYSE:HRB), a tax preparation firm, are wondering whether APTC users understand the return filing requirement.
The public exchange plan users who are getting advance premium tax credit (APTC) help have to file tax returns to keep their APTC subsidies.
Some APTC recipients may have earned too little to have to file returns at all under the old rules.
